snippet: The state refuses to base teacher evaluations on student scores, which triggers an outdated standard: that every student be proficient in reading and math.
abstract: Nine out of 10 Washington State public schools have been declared failing under federal education law, having been caught in political battle over education policy; State Legislature has refused to require teacher evaluations to be based in part on test scores; consequently, schools are being held to outdated and all-but-impossible benchmark requiring every student to be proficient in reading and math by 2014.
lead_paragraph: The state refuses to base teacher evaluations on student scores, which triggers an outdated standard: that every student be proficient in reading and math.

headline.main: In Washington State, Political Stand Puts Schools in a Bind
headline.print_headline: In Washington State, Political Stand Puts Schools in a Bind
